titleStmt.title: Description of Free Library of Philadelphia Lewis O 61: Pand-i ʻAṭṭār.

note: Catalog entry describing the manuscript pasted onto the inside front cover.

msContents.summary: Clear copy of a poem on moral precepts and advice. Gold rulings throughout with illuminated headpiece and finispiece.

name.#text: Free Library of Philadelphia. Rare Book Department. John Frederick Lewis collection of Oriental Manuscripts

supportDesc.extent: 41 leaves : 235 x 135 (160 x 85) mm bound to 235 x 150 mm
supportDesc.foliation: Modern foliation added in pencil, upper left recto; catchwords every verso, lower left.

layoutDesc.layout: 11 lines in two columns. Gold rules between and around columns.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Written in nastaʻlīq in black; pointed.

decoNote: Rubrications in red. Dual page illuminated floriate borders of gold and red with illuminated headpiece in gold, pink, blue and red (f. 1v-2r). Illuminated finispiece in silver, gold, red, pink with floral motifs (f. 40v). Gold circular medallion, as if for a colophon or dedication (f. 41r). All pages border ruled in gold and green double rules with gold double rules between the columns and around each title. Page-openings ruled in gold.

decoNote.#text: Gold circle in center of frame

binding.p: Brown leather over pasteboard with flap (Type II). Covers painted with frames of gold, red, and orange with a gold tooled diaper grid central fill, somewhat effaced. Coordinated design on flap. Silver sprinkled pink paper doublure.

origin.p: Item is dated Shaʻbān 1235 A.H. and was copied by Aḥmad Rushdī, a student of Muḥammad Ḥāmid

provenance: Gift of Anne Baker Lewis in 1933.
Formerly owned by John Frederick Lewis.

surface.@n: Inside back cover flap opened to show design
Back cover flap opened to show design
Fore edge flap closed, inside front cover
